questions.question: Tell me about a time you had a conflict with a teammate. How did you handle it?
questions.what_theyre_testing: Communication skills, emotional intelligence, problem-solving, ability to maintain professional relationships
questions.good_answer_structure: Use the STAR method (Situation, Task, Action, Result). Focus on the resolution and what you learned, not assigning blame. Emphasize how you maintained respect and found common ground.

questions.question: Describe a time when you failed at something. What did you learn?
questions.good_answer_structure: Choose a genuine failure (not a humble brag). Explain the situation, your specific role in the failure, what you learned, and how you've applied that learning since.

questions.question: Tell me about a time you led a project or initiative. What was the outcome?
questions.what_theyre_testing: Leadership style, ability to influence without authority, project management, results orientation
questions.good_answer_structure: Describe the project scope, team dynamics, your specific leadership actions (delegation, motivation, problem-solving), and measurable outcomes.

questions.question: Describe a situation where you had to work under a tight deadline. How did you manage it?
questions.what_theyre_testing: Time management, prioritization, stress handling, communication under pressure
questions.good_answer_structure: Explain the deadline pressure, how you prioritized tasks, any trade-offs you made, how you communicated with stakeholders, and the final result.

questions.question: Tell me about a time you had to convince someone to see things your way. How did you approach it?
questions.what_theyre_testing: Persuasion skills, empathy, ability to build consensus, stakeholder management
questions.good_answer_structure: Show how you understood their perspective first, built rapport, presented your case with evidence, and found a win-win solution.
